turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm having trouble with my new smart coffee maker. It won't connect to my Wi-Fi.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble. Let's troubleshoot this. First, can you confirm the model number of your coffee maker?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's the BrewMaster 3000. I've tried everything! I've reset it, restarted my router... I'm getting really frustrated.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I understand. Thanks for providing the model number. Let's try a different approach. Have you checked the Wi-Fi password you entered on the coffee maker? It is case-sensitive.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, I triple-checked the password! Still nothing. It keeps saying 'incorrect password' even though I know it's correct!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hmm, that's odd. Can you tell me what type of security your Wi-Fi network is using (e.g., WPA2, WPA3)? Also, is the coffee maker in range of your Wi-Fi signal?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's WPA2, and yes, it's literally right next to the router! Okay, here's a tricky one: Is the coffee maker compatible with a mesh Wi-Fi network? I have a mesh system.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's an excellent question. The BrewMaster 3000 *should* be compatible with most mesh Wi-Fi systems, but it can sometimes have issues. Let's try this: temporarily disable the 5 GHz band on your router, and see if the coffee maker connects to the 2.4 GHz band. Often older devices have trouble with 5ghz.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wow, that actually worked! I can't believe it! Thank you so much! I'm finally getting my coffee fix.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Great! I'm glad we could resolve the issue. Enjoy your coffee! If you have any other questions, please feel free to ask.
